TEXT: The first applicant , PERSON , is the NORP national who was born in DATE and currently resides in GPE , GPE . The second applicant , Mr PERSON , is the first applicant ’s son , born in DATE and living in GPE . The respondent Government are represented by Mr PERSON , Representative of GPE at ORG .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

According to the first applicant , in DATE she left her place of permanent residence in GPE in GPE ( GPE ) , GPE , and moved to GPE in GPE . In DATE she unsuccessfully applied to the ORG pension authority for an old - age pension . Her request was rejected on DATE and , in DATE , she brought court proceedings against the NORP pension authority , claiming the assessment and payment of her old - age pension as of DATE . She also claimed damages for its non – payment since DATE .
On DATE ORG dismissed the action on the ground that the first applicant was no longer living in GPE and had not obtained “ registration ” ( регистрация ) there .
On DATE ORG rejected the first applicant ’s appeal .

Upon the first applicant ’s requests ( надзор ) , the Deputy Prosecutor General of GPE lodged an application for supervisory review ( протест ) , requesting ORG to quash the above decisions on the ground that the case had been wrongly determined .

On DATE ORG granted the prosecutor ’s application , finding that LAW and other statutes entitled the first applicant to receive her old - age pension from DATE , i.e. as of DATE , regardless of her place of residence . The court reversed the decisions of CARDINAL DATE and DATE , and ordered the NORP pension authority to determine and pay the first applicant ’s pension as from DATE . The court rejected the first applicant ’s claim insofar as she had requested an award of damages .
According to the ORG , a writ of execution ( исполнительный лист ) in respect of the decision of CARDINAL DATE did not reach the Bailiffs until DATE .

On DATE the pension authority transferred the first applicant ’s pension arrears of ORG CARDINAL,CARDINAL for the period between CARDINAL DATE and DATE to the Bailiffs . As of CARDINAL DATE the authority calculated and paid the first applicant ’s index - linked pension , transferring the money to her bank account . According to the Government , the enforcement proceedings in respect of the decision of DATE were successfully terminated on DATE .

On DATE the pension authorities in GPE informed the first applicant that the NORP pension authority had applied to ORG of GPE , requesting it to submit a further application for the “ supervisory review ” of the decision of DATE .

On DATE the Deputy President of ORG of GPE lodged an application for the supervisory review against the decisions , requesting ORG of GPE to quash them on the ground that the substantive law had been applied incorrectly .

On DATE ORG of GPE accepted the application , set aside the decisions of DATE , DATE and DATE , and returned the case for fresh examination at first instance . It found , among other things , that the lower courts had failed to take into account the provisions of LAW of CARDINAL DATE ( “ LAW ” ) in relation to pensions and , as a result , had failed to establish all relevant facts . According to the court , the first applicant should have been paid her pension in the place of her permanent residence , pursuant to LAW . In returning the case for a fresh examination , ORG also ordered the lower courts to establish the first applicant ’s nationality and the place of her permanent residence .

On DATE ORG ordered the NORP pension authority to determine and pay the applicant ’s pension as from ORG CARDINAL DATE . The court considered that the applicant ’s entitlement to the old DATE pension had started when she had first brought court proceedings against the pension authority , i.e. in DATE . It also rejected as unsubstantiated the argument of ORG of the Russian Federation regarding the application of LAW in this case .

The ORG further noted that , on DATE , the judgment of CARDINAL DATE had been enforced , and the first applicant had been paid her pension in the amount of FAC for the period from DATE to DATE , and ORG for the period from CARDINAL May to DATE . The amount of the first applicant ’s pension as from DATE was set at ORG DATE .
This decision was upheld on appeal by ORG ( GPE ) on DATE .
On DATE the Deputy President of ORG filed an application for supervisory review against the decisions of DATE and DATE .
By a decision of DATE , ORG ( GPE ) accepted the application , quashed the decisions of CARDINAL March and CARDINAL DATE and returned the case for a fresh examination at first instance .

According to the Government , the first applicant ’s case was listed for trial CARDINAL times , on DATE , DATE and DATE respectively . Since the applicant failed to appear , on DATE ORG disallowed the applicant ’s claim without examining it on the merits .

On an unspecified date , the pension authority filed an application with a court to recover the money paid to the first applicant pursuant to the decisions of DATE and DATE . By a decision of DATE , ORG granted the application and ordered the first applicant to reimburse RUR CARDINAL . The decision could be appealed to ORG ( GPE ) within DATE . The case file contains no indication as to whether the first applicant brought appeal proceedings in this connection , whether the decision has entered into force or whether it has been enforced .

In DATE the second applicant arrived in GPE from ORG . He soon entered a higher education establishment and started living in his relative ’s flat in GPE . The second applicant ’s application for registration at his relative ’s address in GPE was refused by the interior authorities . He brought a court action , claiming that the authorities’ refusal was unlawful .

On DATE ORG rejected the action . The court found that he lived in PERSON where he was registered . By reference to the special governmental regulations of DATE , ORG ruled that the second applicant could not be registered at the relative ’s address in GPE because inter alia he had failed to prove that he was a close relative . On DATE ORG rejected the second applicant ’s appeal .

Upon the second applicant ’s requests , on DATE the Deputy President of ORG of GPE lodged an application for supervisory review against the above decisions , claiming that there had been an unlawful interference with the applicant ’s constitutional right freely to choose his place of residence .
On DATE ORG rejected the Deputy President ’s application , upholding the previous court decisions in the case .

Upon the Deputy President ’s further application for supervisory review , on DATE ORG of the Russian Federation quashed the above decisions , finding that the authorities’ refusal of the second applicant ’s “ registration ” in GPE had been unlawful . By reference to the LAW and the Right to Freedom of Movement and Choice of Residence Act , ORG stated that the fact of “ registration ” , or the absence thereof , had no legal consequences on the right of an individual freely to choose his place of residence . ORG held that the statutory “ registration ” procedures recorded information as to the individual ’s actual place of permanent residence following his free choice thereof , and these procedures could not involve any restriction on the exercise of that freedom . According to the court , it was the authorities’ obligation , not their right , to register the second applicant as living permanently in GPE , in accordance with the procedure established by ORG . ORG ordered the GPE interior authority to “ register ” the second applicant at his relative ’s address in GPE . That judgment was final .
After a further refusal on documentary grounds , on DATE the second applicant was finally registered in GPE .
LAW ( LAW entitle every citizen to an old - age pension , the amount of which depends on the record of the individual ’s employment and related activities .
LAW in the field of pensions of CARDINAL DATE ( LAW ) provides that the pensions of citizens of ORG are calculated and paid at the place of their permanent residence .

Article CARDINAL § CARDINAL of the LAW and the Right to Freedom of Movement and Choice of Residence Act guarantee to everyone lawfully within the territory of the ORG the right freely to move and choose the place of residence in GPE . “ Registration ” at a particular address , by way of a special seal in the individual ’s passport , is considered to be one ’s place of permanent residence for the purposes of NORP law .

Section CARDINAL of the LAW provides that an individual must present to the interior authorities documents certifying his or her identity and place of residence in order to have the “ registration ” entered or changed .
